content.raw:
Recently, I've been seeing failures with the following console message:

~~~
UNIT_ImagesView_TEST: /usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/mutex.hpp:108:
 boost::mutex::~mutex(): Assertion `!posix::pthread_mutex_destroy(&m)' failed.
~~~

I've captured backtraces [here](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/10bd9190751344876f37).
content.html:
Recently, I've been seeing failures with the following console message:

UNIT_ImagesView_TEST: /usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/mutex.hpp:108:
 boost::mutex::~mutex(): Assertion `!posix::pthread_mutex_destroy(&m)' failed.

I've captured backtraces here.

content.raw: Not sure if it's still producing the the same backtrace as the one in the description but usually it happens if we manually call `delete` on a qt widget in our code. Later when Qt is shutting down, its parent widget will try to clean up and delete the qwidget (which we deleted) and this causes double deletion.
content.html: Not sure if it's still producing the the same backtrace as the one in the description but usually it happens if we manually call delete on a qt widget in our code. Later when Qt is shutting down, its parent widget will try to clean up and delete the qwidget (which we deleted) and this causes double deletion.

content.raw: pull request #2194 has fixed the failures on gazebo7, but it is now failing more frequently on default with backtraces that reference `ImageFrame`. It may be related to the changes made to `ImageFrame` in pull request #2112
content.html: pull request #2194 has fixed the failures on gazebo7, but it is now failing more frequently on default with backtraces that reference ImageFrame. It may be related to the changes made to ImageFrame in pull request #2112

content.raw:
new backtrace on default:

* https://gist.github.com/scpeters/3cadcd85a45513023f60

it often happens in `~QImage` called during `~ImageFramePrivate`, which is called during `ImagesView::UpdateImpl`
content.html:
new backtrace on default:

  • https://gist.github.com/scpeters/3cadcd85a45513023f60

it often happens in ~QImage called during ~ImageFramePrivate, which is called during ImagesView::UpdateImpl

content.raw:
I've observed a infrequent but repeatable memory corruption failure at the beginning of the test. The test still proceeds for some amount before failing:

~~~
171: [Err] [Scene.cc:2958] Light [sun] not found. Use topic ~/factory/light to spawn a new light.
171: *** Error in `gazebo/gui/viewers/UNIT_ImagesView_TEST': double free or corruption (fasttop): 0x00002b48dc017260 ***
171: [Msg] cam1 to cam6
171: [Msg] cam6 to cam1
171: [Msg] Random switch [1] of 25. Number of images [1]
171: [Msg] Random switch [2] of 25. Number of images [3]
~~~

Two separate but similar [backtraces here](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/41a8325a530099e72e17d1ed1f60add0).
content.html:
I've observed a infrequent but repeatable memory corruption failure at the beginning of the test. The test still proceeds for some amount before failing:

171: [Err] [Scene.cc:2958] Light [sun] not found. Use topic ~/factory/light to spawn a new light.
171: *** Error in `gazebo/gui/viewers/UNIT_ImagesView_TEST': double free or corruption (fasttop): 0x00002b48dc017260 ***
171: [Msg] cam1 to cam6
171: [Msg] cam6 to cam1
171: [Msg] Random switch [1] of 25. Number of images [1]
171: [Msg] Random switch [2] of 25. Number of images [3]

Two separate but similar backtraces here.
